intro: Lophanthus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and lobed leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or pink, with five petals and a distinctive central disc. Lophanthus species are often used in traditional medicine and are adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments.
